verses.kjv: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
verses.ct: Don't brag about what you'll do tomorrow, because you have no idea what any given day might bring.

verses.kjv: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.
verses.ct: Let someone else compliment you — not your own mouth. Let an outsider speak well of you — not your own lips.

verses.kjv: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both.
verses.ct: Rocks are heavy and sand is a burden to carry, but the frustration caused by a fool outweighs both of them.

verses.kjv: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?
verses.ct: Anger is cruel and rage is overwhelming, but who can withstand jealousy?

verses.kjv: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
verses.ct: An honest correction spoken openly is more valuable than love that stays hidden.

verses.kjv: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.ct: The wounds that come from a friend can be trusted, but an enemy's kisses are full of deception.

verses.kjv: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
verses.ct: A person who is full will turn away even honey, but to a hungry person, even something bitter tastes sweet.

verses.kjv: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.
verses.ct: Like a bird that strays from its nest, so is a person who drifts away from home.

verses.kjv: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.
verses.ct: Perfume and fragrant oil bring joy to the heart, and in the same way, a friend's sincere advice refreshes the soul.

verses.kjv: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.
verses.ct: Don't abandon your own friend or your father's friend. And don't run to your brother's house when disaster hits — a neighbor who is close by is more helpful than a brother who lives far away.

verses.kjv: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.
verses.ct: My son, pursue wisdom and bring joy to my heart, so I can respond to anyone who criticizes me.

verses.kjv: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.
verses.ct: A sensible person sees danger coming and takes cover, but the inexperienced walk right into it and pay the price.

verses.kjv: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
verses.ct: Take the coat of anyone who guarantees a loan for a stranger; hold something as collateral from whoever pledges security for an unfamiliar woman.

verses.kjv: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.
verses.ct: If you shout a blessing to your friend early in the morning at the top of your lungs, it will be treated as a curse instead.

verses.kjv: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.
verses.ct: A constant drip on a rainy day and a quarrelsome wife are just alike.

verses.kjv: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.
verses.ct: Trying to restrain her is like trying to hold back the wind or grip oil in your hand.

verses.kjv: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.ct: Just as iron sharpens iron, one person sharpens another.

verses.kjv: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.
verses.ct: Whoever tends a fig tree will enjoy its fruit, and whoever serves their master faithfully will be honored.

verses.kjv: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
verses.ct: Just as water reflects your face back to you, so one person's heart reflects who they truly are to another.

verses.kjv: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
verses.ct: The grave and destruction are never filled up, and human desires are never fully satisfied either.

verses.kjv: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.
verses.ct: A crucible tests silver and a furnace tests gold, and a person is tested by the praise they receive.

verses.kjv: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
verses.ct: Even if you crushed a fool with a pestle in a mortar along with grain, their foolishness still wouldn't leave them.

verses.kjv: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.
verses.ct: Make sure you know the condition of your flocks, and pay careful attention to your herds.

verses.kjv: For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?
verses.ct: Wealth doesn't last forever, and does a crown endure through every generation?

verses.kjv: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.
verses.ct: When the hay is harvested and new growth appears and the mountain grasses are gathered in,

verses.kjv: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.
verses.ct: the lambs will provide your clothing, and the goats will cover the cost of your land.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.
verses.ct: There will be plenty of goat's milk to feed you, to nourish your household, and to sustain your servant girls.
